monophosphate deaminase deficiency
How many people are affected by adenosine monophosphate deaminase deficiency ?,"AMP deaminase deficiency is one of the most common inherited muscle disorders in white populations, affecting 1 in 50 to 100 people. The prevalence is lower in African Americans, affecting an estimated 1 in 40,000 people, and the condition is even less common in the Japanese population.",GHR,adenosine monophosphate deaminase deficiency
